intro: Lappula desertorum, commonly known as desert lappula, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of Eurasia. It is a member of the Papaveraceae family, which includes poppies and other flowering plants. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Its flowers are small and usually yellow or greenish, and it produces a capsule containing numerous tiny seeds. Lappula desertorum plays a role in stabilizing soil in its native habitats and is of interest to botanists studying xerophytic plants.
